beans.description:
Demonstrates an adaptor which reads from IBM MQ directly and writes to stdout. The data read off the queue is passed directly to the WriteConnector.
Data originates: IBM MQ Series. Data terminates: stdout unless a file is specified.
Run using java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config mq-reader.xml -props ../../../config/mq.properties
mq.properties is a properties format file which should be edited to supply specific mq property values e.g. channel etc. Alternatively just edit MQSeries_WriteConnector below directly.
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar mq.jar (this is not distributed with openadaptor) connector-api.jar (From JCA. Certain versions of MQ may not require this. Also not distributed)
Once it is running, verify that this is working you need to be running the corresponding mq-writer example.

bean.description: This creates the simple pipeline MQSeries_ReadConnector -> WriteConnector.
Define the MQ Connector used by the ReadConnector.
Set one or other (not both) of useLocalTransactions and useXATransactions to true so as to enable the appropriate transaction mode.
